Walking_Buddha
Seven Line Prayer\u0020

HUNG ORGYEN YÜL GYI NUB JANG TSHAM 
 PEMA GESAR DONG PO LA 
 YA TSHEN CHOG GI NGÖ DRUB NYE 
 PEMA JUNG NE ZHE SU DRAG 
 KHOR DU KHANDRO MANG PÖ KOR 
 KHYED KYI JE SU DAG DRUB KYI 
 JIN GYI LOB CHIR SHEG SU SÖ 
 GURU PEMA SIDDHI HUNG

The Seven-Line prayer is called “the King of Prayers”. Through repetition of this prayer many obstacles can be removed from your life, and your connection to your own spiritual nature is strengthened. With unshakable faith, visualize Guru Rinpoche, the embodiment of all refuges on the crown of ones head and pray. (insert 7 line prayer)
Guru Pema Siddhi Hung
OM AH HUNG BENZAR GURU PEMA SIDDHI HUNG
Guru Pema Description
Amitaba\u0020
OM AH MI DHE WA HRI

oṃ amideva hrīḥ - Amitabha is the Buddha of infinite light. His special quality is infinite and boundless compassion. It is taught that such is the depth of his compassion for all sentient beings in all places, states and times - that remembering his name or repeating his mantra will lead to the easing and eventual end of the poisons in ones life. Emotions can stabilize and spiritual health can increase. It is said that upon ones death, merely thinking of him will lead to rebirth in a “pure” realm.
Avaloketshvara (Chenrezig)\u0020
OM MANI PEME HUNG

Om Mani Padme Hum: It is said that all the teachings of the Buddha are contained in this mantra. Om (perfection in practice of generosity) Ma (perfection in the practice of pure ethics) Ni (perfection in the practice of tolerance and patience) Pad (perfection of perseverance) Me (perfection in the practice of concentration) Hum (perfection in the practice of Wisdom). The six syllables purify the six realms of existence in suffering. Saying the mantra invokes the powerful benevolent attention and blessings of Chenrezig, the embodiment of compassion.
Green Tara\u0020
OM TARE TUTTARE TURE SWAHA

Green Tara is a Bodhisattva that embodies compassion in female form. She protects from all kinds of fears, danger and suffering through her mantra, Om Tare Tuttare Ture Svaha. By praying to Green Tara, one awakens the wisdom, clarity and compassion that protects from all harms. She represents compassion in action.
White Tara\u0020
OM TARE TUTTARE TURE PUNYE PUSHTIM AH YU PUSHTIM KU RU YE SWAHA

White Tara is associated with long life and her mantra is often chanted with a particular person in mind. Specifically Mama means “mine” – that you want the qualities of long life, merit, wisdom and compassion either for yourself or another. Ayuh mean long life. Punya refers to the results of living life ethically – which would be a long and happy life. Jnana means wisdom. Pushtim means abundance or increase. Kuru “make it so”. Svaha means many blessings be upon you. So repeating the mantra is a prayer for the increase of merit and wisdom to the extent that one can become enlightened and be of benefit and end the suffering of all sentient beings.
Manjushri\u0020
OM AH RA PA TSA NA DHI

Om Ah Ra Pa Tsa Na Dhih: Manjushri is the bodhisattva of Wisdom. The Mantra helps enhance various wisdoms. It helps clear the mind cutting through delusion to discover the true nature of reality or the true nature of the self. That true nature being emptiness. This teaching is fundamental to all forms of Buddhism and is often called “Mother of All Buddhas”
One Hundred Syllable Mantra of Vajrasattva (Dorje Sempa)\u0020

OM BENZAR SATO SAMAYA MA NU PA LA YA 
 BENZAR SATO TE NO PA TISH TRA DRI DHO ME BHA WA 
 SUTO KHAYO ME BHA WA SUPO KHAYO ME BHA WA 
 ANU RAKTO ME BHA WA SARWA SIDDHIM ME PRA YATTSHA 
 SARWA KARMA SU TSA ME TSITTAM SHRI YAM KU RU HUNG 
 HA HA HA HA HO BHAGAWAN SARWA TATHAGATA 
 BENZAR MA ME MUÑTSA BENZAR BHA WA 
 MA HA SAMAYA SATO AH

Vajrasattva – Or the One Hundred Syllable Manta is known as the Prince of Purity. He represents the perfect union of Wisdom and Compassion. Repeating this mantra as many as 100,000 times (or more) is a powerful tool to purify karma or cause and effect. It can pave the way to the perfect understanding of the true nature of reality (emptiness) and bodhichitta (ultimate compassion).
Six Syllable Mantra of Vajrasattva (Dorje Sempa)\u0020
OM BENZAR SATO HUNG

Banza Sato Hung. Vajrasattva is known as the Prince of Purity. He represents the perfect union of Wisdom and Compassion. Repeating this mantra as many as 100,000 times (or more) is a powerful tool to purify karma or cause and effect. It can pave the way to the perfect understanding of the true nature of reality (emptiness) and bodhichitta (ultimate compassion).

All donations go to maintain the Amitabha Stupa in Sedona Arizona so that it and it's 13 surrounding acres remain freely open to the public as a place of pilgrimage. 

 What is a stupa? Imagine a place where you can go to pray that magnifies that prayer a hundred fold. A place where a living presence of compassion and enlightened mind exists with the sole purpose of being a beacon that radiates blessings to all who come within 100 miles of its location. That's exactly what a stupa is. When you come to a stupa to make prayers with the pure intention of bringing benefit to others, it can change your life, your heart, your mind profoundly. 

 What is a mantra? In short, a prayer to purify the mind from any suffering or obscuration. 

Please pass this along to all who would benefit.

Welcome to Walking Buddha. 

Please sign in so that we can share your prayers with the 
world. 

   ~The Walking Buddha Team

Peace does not come through prayer, we human beings 
must create peace. 

  ~ The Dalai Lama

The Future Depends On The Present 

        ~H.H. Dalai Lama. 
 
 We offer this app to you with the hope 
 that suffering will be alleviated in all 
 forms throughout the world starting 
 today and until it ends.
 
       ~The Walking Buddha Team
